examples/advanced-banners.title: Advanced Banners
examples/advanced-banners.description: The `` accepts advanced configurations that can allow you to really push the effect. Building off the previous banner demos, this one adds a number of configuration options.

examples/banners.title: Parallax Banners
examples/banners.description: The following demonstrates some common usage of the `` component.

examples/easing.title: Easing Animation
examples/easing.description: You can provide easing presets or cubic-bezier curve params to the useParallax hook or `` component.

examples/how-it-works.title: How it works
examples/how-it-works.description: As the element scrolls past the viewport a css translate effect is applied based on the original element's position relative to the viewport. Using the speed will automatically apply a translateY css style (or translateX if the scroll axis is horizontal).

examples/scroll-effects.title: Scroll Effects
examples/scroll-effects.description: More than just translate effects are possible. Here's some examples of the various effects possible.

migration-guides/v1-migration-guide.title: V1 Migration Guide
migration-guides/v1-migration-guide.description: Some breaking changes were introduced in v2. Here's the simple changes that need to be made if you're coming from v1.

migration-guides/v2-migration-guide.title: V2 Migration Guide
migration-guides/v2-migration-guide.description: With mostly just new features, V3 also makes a few breaking changes. See the following and migrate any code that is affected.

usage/components/parallax-banner-compone.title: ParallaxBanner
usage/components/parallax-banner-compone.description: Component that sets up layers of useParallax elements to achieve a parallaxing banner. Enables the layering of images, or custom markup, with scroll effects in a container that hides overflow.

usage/components/parallax-component.title: Parallax
usage/components/parallax-component.description: The main component for applying scroll effects based on an elements position within the viewport.

usage/components/parallax-provider.title: ParallaxProvider
usage/components/parallax-provider.description: The `` component is meant to wrap a root level component in your application and is necessary to provide access through the React context API to the Parallax Controller.

usage/hooks/use-parallax.title: useParallax
usage/hooks/use-parallax.description: Main hook for applying parallax effects to a DOM element. Any of the documented effects and configurations can be passed as params to the hook.

usage/hooks/use-parallax-controller.title: useParallaxController
usage/hooks/use-parallax-controller.description: This hook provides you access to the ParallaxController via React context. The hook must be called in a component rendered within the ``. The most common usage of the controller is to update cache if the page layout has changed.

usage/parallax-props.title: Parallax Props
usage/parallax-props.description: The following hooks and components accept the parallax prop configurations that setup scroll effects in the Parallax Controller.
